main event: On February 4, 1959, a cone-shaped object with a brilliant combination of three colors was observed for 12 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as quite large and cone-shaped,It exhibited a brilliant iridescent appearance, blending white, yellow, and blue colors,No tail or exhaust was observed,The sighting occurred over Balboa Basin in the Canal Zone,The conclusion drawn was that the object was probably a meteor.
witness description: Civilian pilot with good observational skills
